Name: Amulets and beads
Description: String of assorted faience beads, including leaf and petal pendants, and miniature grape bunches, from el-`Amarna, the city founded in Middle Egypt as Residence and centre of the sun-cult under Akhenaten. The polychrome glaze is typical of the luxurious products of the city, constructed at a time of increased trade between Egypt and the technologically more advanced centres in Western Asia.
